title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 581-2.4 - Cessation of illegal development or subdivision; immediate abatement and remediation

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 581-2.4 - Cessation of illegal development or subdivision; immediate abatement and remediation

State Regulations
(a) In the
case of an apparent violation involving ongoing construction, land disturbance
or subdivision of land, the landowner and all lessees, contractors, builders, and other agents may be ordered in writing to cease and desist such activities
until the apparent violation is resolved according to the provisions of this

Part or by a court. When there is a danger that the elements may cause
irreparable damage to a partially completed use or structure, the order or a
modification thereto may allow measures to prevent such damage provided that
such authorization shall not substitute for any required permit or
variance. (b) In the case of an
apparent violation involving ongoing or threatened damage to the resources of
the Adirondack Park, the landowner and all lessees, contractors, builders, and
other agents may be requested in writing to take immediate measures to redress
such ongoing or threatened damage. Notes
